Comment: Good day , Flamerider. I just wanted to point out some tactical losses in this game for you. Some may be more or less obvious but you can see for yourself what you had missed.
the plan would've worked with 5...Nd4 , if 6.c3 or other attempts to dive knight away, then with 6...Bh3! making it impossible for queen to move on f3(or leave the square at all.)

Hard to find any kind of plan here.you have only two rooks and a bishop. Kingside advance would likely to lead nowhere.its time to find your 7th rank position. best way to do that is through c file is to drible threatning the weak pawn in d5 by 23...Rb5 24.Bc3 24...Rc5 if white tries to trade, then Rc3! and you have a black bishop to back up and queenside is yours. this is the true advantage of bishop of different colour when there is no such bishop with your enemy or knights. E file is not the right path since white bishop is guarding.
(Rc1! -25...f3 is no threat, doesnt really matter if one loses g pawn in the endgame)
